publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts-That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent.

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-544 Poll Tax Debts (lodged on 14 February 2000) Alex Neil*
S1M-544 Poll Tax Debts (lodged on 14 February 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-544 Poll Tax Debts (lodged on 14 February 2000) Christine Grahame*

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame

S1M-544 Tommy Sheridan: Poll Tax Debts—That the Parliament believes that, in the light of the recent Accounts Commission report Benefits, Finance and Housing, the need to write off local authority poll tax debts is now urgent. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame
